content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Certainly! Below is a Julia function that takes a markdown document as input and extracts all Julia language code blocks, removes the code fences, and joins the code blocks together with a newline:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Define the start and end of a Julia code block
    start_fence = "```julia"
    end_fence = "```"

    # Initialize an empty array to hold the code blocks
    code_blocks = []

    # Split the document into lines
    lines = split(md, '\n')

    # Initialize a flag to track whether we are inside a code block
    in_code_block = false

    # Initialize an empty string to accumulate the current code block
    current_block = []

    # Iterate over each line in the document
    for line in lines
        # Check if the line is the start of a Julia code block
        if startswith(line, start_fence)
            in_code_block = true
            continue
        end

        # Check if the line is the end of a code block
        if line == end_fence
            in_code_block = false
            # Add the current code block to the list and reset it
            push!(code_blocks, join(current_block, '\n'))
            current_block = []
            continue
        end

        # If we are inside a code block, add the line to the current block
        if in_code_block
            push!(current_block, line)
        end
    end

    # Join all the code blocks with a newline and return the result
    return join(code_blocks, '\n\n')
end
```

This function will process the markdown document, extract all the Julia code blocks, and return them as a single string with each block separated by a double newline.
